qas.question: In February of 2014, what did Swiss voters narrowly approve to restrict?
What was reintroduced on the influx of foreigners in February of 2014?
Which centres of Switzerland mostly rejected the quota system for foreigners?
What was the rejection rate of the quota system by the French speaking part of Switzerland?
What do some news commentators claim is violated by the restricted immigration proposal?

answers.text: bilateral agreements on the free movement of persons

context: On 9 February 2014, Swiss voters narrowly approved by 50.3% a ballot initiative launched by the national conservative Swiss People's Party (SVP/UDC) to restrict <a0_0>immigration<a0_0/>, and thus reintroducing <a1_0>a quota system<a1_0/> on the influx of foreigners. This initiative was mostly backed by rural (57.6% approvals), suburban (51.2% approvals), and isolated cities (51.3% approvals) of Switzerland as well as by a strong majority (69.2% approval) in the canton of Ticino, while <a2_0>metropolitan<a2_0/> centres (58.5% rejection) and the French-speaking part (<a3_0>58.5%<a3_0/> rejection) of Switzerland rather rejected it. Some news commentators claim that this proposal de facto contradicts the <a4_0>bilateral agreements on the free movement of persons<a4_0/> from these respective countries.
